abstract: The Airgas chief executive may have gotten himself into a sticky legal predicament when he exercised 300,000 stock options in the middle of deal talks with unwanted suitor Air Products, according to an analysis by the Deal Professor and White Collar Watch.
snippet: The Airgas chief executive may have gotten himself into a sticky legal predicament when he exercised 300,000 stock options in the middle of deal talks with unwanted suitor Air Products, according to an analysis by the Deal Professor and White Coll...
lead_paragraph: Updated | Feb. 14, 6:06 p.m. and Feb. 12 6:18 p.m. and 3:50 p.m. This post is by Steven M. Davidoff and Peter J. Henning.

headline.main: What Was the Airgas Chief Thinking?

byline.original: By Steven Davidoff Solomon and Peter J. Henning
